conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying. School_A is my first choice because I strongly value your academic environment and I’m ready to commit if admitted. If you have any specific materials or criteria you want emphasized, I can provide them promptly.
conversation.thought: Go for my top choice immediately. School_A has capacity 1 and ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D). If I delay, they may fill the seat with a higher-priority applicant. An early [APPLY] gives me the best chance to secure my #1 before the market moves.

conversation.message: Student_A, thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the rest of the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is applying to us as their first choice. On our true priority list, Student_A is 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D). In round 1, only Student_A has applied to us; there is no immediate competing applicant in our inbox. However, Student_B ranks us 3rd and Student_D ranks us 2nd, so they may apply elsewhere first (Student_B to School_B; Student_D to School_C) and only come to us if rejected. If we accept Student_A now, we fill our sole quota and forgo the chance to match with Student_B or Student_D if they later apply. Given our objective to match as high as possible on our priority list, it is strategically better to reject Student_A now and keep capacity for higher-priority students who may arrive in later rounds.
